pullRequest.title: Hiding accessToken key in Body
pullRequest.bodyText: Form Recognizer has accessToken key in the Body, but it is sensitive content and should not be explored to external user.

nodes.bodyText: Should this be only called ACCESS_TOKEN_KEY_PATTERN?
Should we write simple unit test for this?
Missing copy authorization changes in this PR?
I think rather than current we add a new tag unreleased_package in the version_client.txt file.
This should be FormRecognizerException now after the exception changes?

I see that we are removing the entire keyset.
Should we rather have only the key value redacted like "accessToken" : REDACTED?
Thoughts?

nodes.bodyText: Is accessToken being redacted properly, it looks like its still being recorded.

commit.message: enhance the unit tests for RecordingRedactor

nodes.bodyText:
This is using the wrong version tag. You should add an unreleased_com.azure:azure-core-test;1.3.0-beta.1 into version_client.txt and then change this tag to
<!-- {x-version-update;unreleased_com.azure:azure-core-test;dependency} -->

commit.message: use the correct unreleased version format
add an unit test for non-sensitive data contend

nodes.bodyText: nit: please put this unreleased_ library under the unreleased section below.
